All ages can be infected but the severity 58 of the disease depends on age, associated co-morbidities (as diabetes mellitus, 59 cardiovascular diseases, and renal failure), and smoking history. Surprisingly, 60 children showed mild forms of the disease [12]. However, no age is immune to severe 61 affection because progression is suggested to be attributed to the marked elevation of 62 inflammatory cytokines such as IL2, IL7, IL10, GCSF, and TNFα [13] .

Generally, the 105 main target in such adaptation circle around three main pillars: manage the surgeries 106 according to their priority, protect health care workers, and allocate the available 107 resources toward disease control. 108 1) Outpatient clinic measures: 109 Surgeons are advised to widen the follow up visits after surgeries to decrease 110 the crowd in the clinics. Patients who are in the waiting list with imminent due 111 dates are called to inform them regarding the new circumstances and the 112 postponing of their surgeries and asked them not to visit the clinic until the arrangement of new dates. The number of attendant patients in the clinic are 114 reduced to the half and the duration of clinic is doubled to ensure low number 115 of patients at any time in the clinic. A thermal scanner in the clinic is better be 116 available to trace those who have fever and refer them to the emergency 117 department for proper assessment [19]. 118 The surgeons in duty in the clinics are divided into two groups; each group 119 takes over a period of time in the clinic. So, each surgeon theoretically will 120 expose to a quarter of the usual number of patients. Protective face mask is 121 advised for every health care worker and regular hand disinfection by ethanol 122 alcohol 70%, or water and soup is a mandatory measure between each patient 123 to control the spread of the disease. 124 Certain simple clinic procedures are activated to decrease the burden on 125 surgical lists such as: intra-articular steroid injection in arthritis cases to 126 decrease pain exacerbation and delay the need for surgical treatment, steroid 127 injection for tendinopathy cases as rotator cuff tendinopathy, Golfer's and 128 Tennis elbow, steroid injection for Carpal Tunnel Syndrome, and 129 percutaneous tenotomy for talipes equinovarus cases. 130 A cell phone number with WhatsApp service are given to all clinic attendee to 131 keep in contact in case of emergency and to send clinical photos regarding the 132 wounds and the dressings in case of any inquiry. A home delivery service of 133 medications is advised for all patients rather than regular visits to hospitals and 134 pharmacies to ensure good distancing among the individuals. 135 AAOS recommends activation of telemedicine amid this pandemic in the form 136 of telephone visits, video conferencing, and E-visits [20]. institutional policies and recommendations from Federal and 142 local authorities, considering the availability of finite and essential 143 resources. TABREF0.text: and beta subfamilies originate in mammals particularly bats. On addition, alpha subfamily causes mild symptomatic infection or no symptoms at all, beta subfamily can cause serious respiratory symptoms [4,5]. COVID-19 shares 79% sequence identity with SARS-CoV, the virus that caused an outbreak in China on 2003 [6], and shares 96% of the whole-genome to a bat Coronavirus raising the suspicion of bats` origin of the disease [5]. Disease transmission mainly occurs via heavy droplets that are sneezed or coughed by 47 symptomatic cases and probably asymptomatic carriers that spread in area of 1-2 m in diameter. Inhalation of these heavy droplets or touching contaminated surfaces with the virus then contact mouth, nose, or eye can transmit the infection [7]. The virus can live on surfaces for several days but can easily destroyed upon usage of disinfectants 51 as hydrogen peroxide or ethanol alcohol 70% [8]. The problem in the disease is that it is highly infectious, a person can be the source of infection to several individuals.
